name: Scott's Coast-to-Coast Famous Chicken Wings
author: ieetcows
summary: Where I'm from, they're just called 'Wings.' I've made this recipe for as long as I can remember - hopping from my hometown of Buffalo, NY, to Raleigh, NC, now to Seattle, WA. This wing recipe has been sought after by many that have tasted them, and I've never given up the recipe or prep method...until now.
ingredients: 25  chicken wings, segmented and patted dry with paper towels
½ cup hot pepper sauce (such as Frank's RedHot®)
directions: Heat oil in a deep-fryer or kettle to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
Gently add the wings, one at a time, to the hot oil
Stir gently to assure the wings do not stick together
Fry the chicken wings in the preheated oil until cooked through and the are floating gently atop the oil, about 15 minutes
An instant-read thermometer inserted into the thickest part of the wing should read 180 degrees F (82 degrees C)
Stir the melted butter, hot pepper sauce, garlic powder, and black pepper together in a large mixing bowl until thoroughly combined
Add the cooked wings to the sauce and turn to coat; transfer to a serving platter
